Class Statistician

  • java.lang.Object
    • Statistician

  • public class Statistician
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a homework assignment; A Statistician keeps track of statistics about a sequence of double numbers.
    Note:
    This file contains only blank implementations ("stubs") for many of the methods because this is a Programming Project for students in Prof. Haiduk's CS 3305 class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Statistician()
      Initialize a new Statistician
      Postcondition:
      This Statistician is newly initialized and has not yet been given any numbers.
      Statistician(Statistician other)
      Initialize a new Statistician as a copy of another Statistician

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Compare this Statistician to another object for equality.
      int length()
      Determine how many numbers have been given to this Statistician.

      Determine the largest number that has been given to this Statistician.
      double mean()
      Determine the arithmetic average of all the numbers that have been given to this Statistician.
      double minimum()
      Determine the smallest number that has been given to this Statistician.
      void nextNumber(double number)
      Give a new number to this Statistician.
      void reset()
      Reset this Statistician to state with no numbers in the sequence.
      static Statistician scale(double scale, Statistician s)
      Create a new Statistician whose state is scaled by parameter scale-- such that "statistics" other than length() are multiplied by scale.
      double sum()
      Determine the sum of all the numbers that have been given to this Statistician.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Create a string representation of this Statistician.
      static Statistician union(Statistician s1, Statistician s2)
      Create a new Statistician that behaves as if it was given all the numbers from two other statisticians.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Statistician

        public Statistician()
        Initialize a new Statistician
        Postcondition:
        This Statistician is newly initialized and has not yet been given any numbers.

      • Statistician

        public Statistician(Statistician other)
        Initialize a new Statistician as a copy of another Statistician
        Parameters:
        other - other is a non-null reference to another Statistician Precondition:
        Other is not null. If it is, then throw NullPointerException Postcondition:
        This Statistician is newly initialized and has been given attributes equal to those of other

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compare this Statistician to another object for equality.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - an object with which this Statistician will be compared
        Returns:
        A return value of true indicates that obj refers to a Statistican object with the same length, sum, minimum and maximum as this Statistician. Otherwise the return value is false.
        Note:
        If obj is null or does not refer to a Statistician object, then the answer is false.

      • length

        public int length()
        Determine how many numbers have been given to this Statistician.
        Returns:
        the count of how many numbers have been given to this Statistician since it was initialized or reinitialized
        Note:
        Giving a Statistician more than Integer.MAX_VALUE numbers, will cause failure with an arithmetic overflow.

      • maximum

        public double maximum()
        Determine the largest number that has been given to this Statistician.
        Returns:
        the largest number that has been given to this Statistician since it was initialized or reinitialized
        Note:
        If length() is zero, then the answer from this method is Double.NaN.

      • mean

        public double mean()
        Determine the arithmetic average of all the numbers that have been given to this Statistician.
        Returns:
        the arithmetic mean of all the number that have been given to this Statistician since it was initialized or reinitializeda
        Note:
        If this Statistician has been given more than Integer.MAX_VALUE numbers, then this method fails because of arithmetic overflow. If length() is zero, then the answer from this method is Double.NaN. If sum() exceeds the bounds of double numbers, then the answer from this method may be Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.

      • minimum

        public double minimum()
        Determine the smallest number that has been given to this Statistician.
        Returns:
        the smallest number that has been given to this Statistician since it was initialized or reinitialized
        Note:
        If length() is zero, then the answer from this method is Double.NaN.

      • nextNumber

        public void nextNumber(double number)
        Give a new number to this Statistician.
        Parameters:
        number - the new number that is being given to this Statisticiana
        Postcondition:
        The specified number has been given to this Statistician and it will be included in any subsequent statistics

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset this Statistician to state with no numbers in the sequence.
        Postcondition:
        This Statistician is reinitialized as if it has never been given any numbers

      • scale

        public static Statistician scale(double scale,
                                 Statistician s)
        Create a new Statistician whose state is scaled by parameter scale-- such that "statistics" other than length() are multiplied by scale. Postcondition:
        The returned Statistician is a scaled copy of parameter s which is not modified.
        Parameters:
        scale - a double scale factor
        s - a reference to a Statistician
        Returns:
        a reference to a new Statiscian that is a scaled copy of parameter s

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Create a string representation of this Statistician. Postcondition:
        State of the Statistician remains unaltered by this method
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String a human readable representation of the Statistician's internal state

      • sum

        public double sum()
        Determine the sum of all the numbers that have been given to this Statistician.
        Returns:
        the sum of all the number that have been given to this Statistician since it was initialized or reinitialized
        Note:
        If the sum exceeds the bounds of double numbers, then the answer from this method may be Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.

      • union

        public static Statistician union(Statistician s1,
                                 Statistician s2)
        Create a new Statistician that behaves as if it was given all the numbers from two other statisticians.
        Parameters:
        s1 - the first of two Statisticians
        s2 - the second of two Statisticians
        Precondition:
        Neither s1 nor s2 is null.
        Returns:
        a new Statistician that acts as if it was given all the numbers from s1 and s2.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Indicates that one or the other or both of the arguments are null.
